alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 05 at 6:25PM EDT until April 05 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Clarendon County in central South Carolina... East central Orangeburg County in central South Carolina... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 624 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Eastern Lake Marion, or 18 miles south of Manning, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Santee Cooper Regional Airport around 635 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Rocks Pond Campground and Marina, Blounts Landing, Eautaw Springs, Indian Bluff Recreation Park, Eutawville and Foreston. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: This Tornado Warning replaces the Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued for the same area. TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to an interior room or closet on the lowest floor of a sturdy building immediately. Report tornadoes, large hail, damaging winds or flooding directly to the Columbia National Weather Service at 803 234 4115 when it is safe to do so. You can also send reports by Facebook or Twitter to NWSColumbia or by e-mail at NWS.Columbia@noaa.gov. This Tornado Warning includes portions of Lake Marion. Boaters, move to shore and take shelter on the lowest floor of the closest sturdy building!
